Other Information.Additional Info: Photocurrent density maintained at 92.68% of initial value after exposure to BSA, indicating effective blocking of large biomolecules.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Detection range: 10–500 nM; sensitivity maintained post-contamination
Other Information.Additional Info: Photocurrent response increased linearly with dopamine concentration, demonstrating unhindered transport of small molecules.

Experimental Validation.Method: PEC performance tests, fluorescence confocal imaging
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Detection limit: 6.0 nM for dopamine; sensitivity retained at 100% post-contamination for TiO2 NTPCs/Z-MOF/hydrogel

Other Information.Additional Info: Z-MOF surface exhibits excellent hydrophilicity and intricate pore structure, impeding protein adsorption while allowing small molecule transport.
Photocurrent signals nearly unchanged after BSA exposure, confirming excellent antibiofouling activity.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Detection range: 10–500 nM; complex biological environment
Other Information.Additional Info: Hierarchical sieving ensures efficient transport of small molecules like dopamine while blocking larger interfering species.

Sieving Mechanism: Hierarchical size exclusion via combined Z-MOF and hydrogel layers

Experimental Validation.Method: PEC biosensor evaluation, fluorescence confocal imaging
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Detection limit: 6.0 nM for dopamine; sensitivity fully retained post-contamination

Other Information.Additional Info: Hydrogel layer provides size screening and material transport channels; Z-MOF enhances hydrophilicity and selectivity.
